title: Sri Lanka should seek to revise IMF targets: CBSL Governor
byline: Sri Lanka should seek to change the targets agreed with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) as part of the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement, the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe noted.

title: Senior Russian official says Greenland could vote to join Russia if Trump does not hurry
byline: Russian Security Council Deputy Chairman Dmitry Medvedev said Greenlanders could vote to join Russia if US President Donald Trump did not move quickly to secure the Arctic island, Interfax reported on Monday (Jan 12).

title: Suspect linked to criminal incident arrested with firearm in Thalahena
byline: An individual linked to a criminal incident has been arrested with a firearm in Thalahena yesterday (12), police stated.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern, North-central, Uva, Eastern and Central provinces.

title: Two Russian nationals rescued after being swept away by strong currents at Ahungalla Beach
byline: Two Russian nationals who went sea bathing at Ahungalla Beach were rescued after being swept away by strong water currents.

title: Donald Trump announces 25% tariff on countries doing business with Iran
byline: US President Donald Trump on Monday said he had imposed a 25% tariff on goods from countries with commercial ties to Iran, a move that could put pressure on Tehran as anti-government protests enter a third week.

title: Outgoing US Ambassador Julie Chung pays farewell call on President
byline: Outgoing United States Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung has paid a courtesy call on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday (12).

title: Apple teams up with Google Gemini for AI-powered Siri
byline: Apple plans to use Google’s Gemini artificial intelligence model to power its updated version of Siri, which is set to launch later this year, the two companies announced Monday.

title: 10 Tamil Nadu fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: A total of 10 Tamil Nadu fishermen have been arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters this morning (13).

title: Veteran journalist Iqbal Athas passes away
byline: Veteran Sri Lankan journalist and defence columnist Iqbal Athas has passed away at the age of 81.

title: Oil prices gain on Iran supply disruption concerns
byline: Oil prices edged higher on Tuesday, as heightened concerns surrounding Iran and potential supply disruptions outweighed the prospect of increased crude supply from Venezuela.

title: Paddy prices to be increased from upcoming season – Dy Agriculture Minister
byline: Steps have been taken to increase the price of paddy starting from the upcoming season, Deputy Minister of Agriculture Namal Karunaratne stated.

title: ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ national programme launch today
byline: The inauguration of ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ national programme will take place in Colombo today (13).

title: Strike launched by GMOA at hospitals in Eastern Province
byline: A strike has been launched by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) at all hospitals in the Eastern Province.

title: IOC instructs National Olympic Committee to hold AGM by end of April
byline: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has instructed the National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka (NOCSL) to hold its Annual General Meeting /Elective General Assembly by the end of April.

title: Forest Conservation Dept. Officer arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: An officer attached to the Forest Conservation Department has been arrested by investigating officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) on charges of soliciting and accepting a bribe amounting to Rs. 30,000 and a bottle of alcohol.

title: Traffic congestion on Southern Expressway following accident
byline: An accident along the Southern Expressway between the Kurundugahahetekma and Welipenna exits this morning has caused heavy traffic congestion.

title: Appeals applications on Grade 06 admissions accepted online from today
byline: The acceptance of appeal applications for Grade 6 school admissions for the year 2026, based on the results of the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, has commenced, the Ministry of Education has announced.

title: NPP activist arrested for pelting stones at SLPP Gampaha PS member’s residence
byline: An individual, alleged to be an activist affiliated with the National People’s Power (NPP), has been arrested for pelting stones at the residence of a member of the Gampaha Pradeshiya Sabha representing the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), in Ambaraluwa, Weliweriya.

title: Govt. will not reverse its programs despite any disaster – President
byline: The government will never use the destruction caused by Cyclone Ditwah as an excuse to reverse or halt its official programs, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stated.

title: Several education sector trade unions to meet President today
byline: A discussion is scheduled to be held between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and several education sector trade unions today (13).

title: One Direction famed Zayn Malik teases first-ever world tour in 2026
byline: British pop star Zayn Malik has excited fans by hinting at his first ever world tour in 2026, though specific dates for India are yet to be revealed.

title: Inauguration ceremony of Rebuilding Sri Lanka national program underway
byline: The inauguration ceremony of the Rebuilding Sri Lanka national program has commenced at the Lotus Hall of the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH), Colombo.

title: US pledges additional US$ 2 million humanitarian assistance for Sri Lanka
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka today announced an additional $2 million in U.S. humanitarian assistance to support communities affected by Cyclone Ditwah, bringing total U.S. assistance for the response to $4 million.

title: Case against Ramith Rambukwella fixed for pre-trial conference
byline: The case filed against Ramith Rambukwella, the son of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, on charges of allegedly acquiring assets through unlawful means, has been ordered to be recalled on February 11 for pre-trial conferences.

title: Motorcyclist arrested for damaging vehicles near Diyatha Uyana
byline: An individual has been arrested for damaging several vehicles with the use of a sharp object while riding a motorcycle in Battaramulla.

title: Extensive consultations to be held on proposed National Electricity Policy
byline: A broad discussion should be held with all relevant stakeholders before arriving at a final decision on the draft prepared for the proposed National Electricity Policy of Sri Lanka, the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Infrastructure and Strategic Development has emphasized.

title: Wimal Weerawansa ends ‘Satyagraha’ against education reforms
byline: Former Minister Wimal Weerawansa, who had been engaging in a continuous ‘Satyagraha’ campaign in front of the Education Ministry, has decided to conclude the agitation.

title: SLBFE provides benefits exceeding Rs. 1 bln for Sri Lankan migrant workers in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has provided benefits exceeding Rs. 1 billion in 2025 for the welfare of Sri Lankan migrant workers and their families.

title: Proposal to increase minimum purchasing price of Samba and Kiri Samba paddy varieties approved
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers granted approval to the proposal to increase the minimum purchasing prices for Samba and Kiri Samba paddy varieties with the objective of increasing production in the upcoming seasons.

title: Digital card system introduced for fuel supply to govt vehicles
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to implement a digital card system to supply fuel to vehicles belonging to government institutions.

title: Cabinet nod given to expand project on management of hypertension and diabetes
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to proceed with the implementation of a project aimed at improving the prevention and management of hypertension and diabetes through primary health care systems.

title: Cabinet approves recruitment of over 23,000 teachers
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to recruit over 23,000 teachers for the state services.

title: Cabinet approval to implement National Fisheries and Aquaculture Policy
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the implementation of the National Fisheries and Aquaculture Policy, which has been formulated with the objective of ensuring the equitable distribution of benefits within the fisheries industry and the sustainable management of fisheries and aquaculture.

title: Govt to continue programme to grant Rs. 6,000 allowance to purchase school stationery
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to continue the programme implemented to provide an allowance of Rs. 6,000 per child to purchase school stationery.

title: Education reforms related to Grade 6 deferred to 2027 - Cabinet Spokesman
byline: A decision has been taken to defer the implementation of the proposed education reforms related to Grade 6 until 2027, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has stated.

title: Myanmar donates 500 MT of rice to cyclone victims in Sri Lanka
byline: A ceremony was held today at the Asia World Port Terminal in Ahlon Township, Yangon Port, to mark the donation and dispatch of 500 metric tons (10,000 bags) of rice from the Republic of the Union of Myanmar to Sri Lanka, which was recently affected by a cyclone.

title: Cabinet approves increase in festival advance for state employees
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to increase the festival advance granted for state employees to Rs. 15,000.

title: Committee on Public Finance directs amendments to ‘Aswesuma’ criteria
byline: The Committee on Public Finance has instructed the officials of the Welfare Benefits Board to amend the existing criteria to make the Aswesuma Welfare Benefits Payment Scheme more effective.

title: South Korean prosecutors demand death penalty for ex-President Yoon
byline: South Korean prosecutors called on Tuesday for the death penalty to be handed down to former president Yoon Suk Yeol for his December 2024 declaration of martial law, which plunged the country into chaos.

title: UN report urges accountability for conflict-related sexual violence in Sri Lanka
byline: A paper published by the UN Human Rights Office this morning highlights that conflict-related sexual violence in Sri Lanka remains largely unaddressed, with survivors, both men and women, still being denied long-overdue justice.

title: Iran official says 2,000 people have been killed in unrest
byline: About 2,000 people including security personnel have been killed in protests in Iran, an Iranian official said on Tuesday, the first time authorities have acknowledged the high death toll from an intense crackdown on two weeks of nationwide unrest.

title: President, PM and teachers’ trade unions discuss education reform process
byline: A meeting between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Prime Minister Dr Harini Amarasuriya and representatives of teachers’ trade unions was held this afternoon (13) at the Presidential Secretariat, according to the President’s Media Division.

title: Govt ready to debate no-confidence motion against PM - Cabinet Spokesman
byline: The government has expressed its readiness to debate the no-confidence motion to be brought forth by opposition MPs against Minister of Education and Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya in Parliament on January 22 and 23, Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Court order issued preventing SLMC from removing CMC councillor
byline: The Colombo District Court has issued an enjoining order preventing the implementation of a letter issued by the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) seeking to terminate the party membership of Colombo Municipal Councilor Zohara Buhary.

title: Trump urges Iranians to keep protesting, says ‘help is on its way’
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump urged Iranians on Tuesday to keep protesting and said help was on the way, without giving details, as Iran’s clerical establishment pressed its crackdown against the biggest demonstrations in years.
